tldr: The authors studied the photochemistry of plastoquinones, a class of trisubstituted isoprenyl-1,4-benzoquinones found in algae and green plants' chloroplasts. They observed various transient intermediates following conventional and nanosecond flash photolysis of plastoquinone-1 and plastoquinone-9. The results provide insight into the function of these quinones in photosynthesis and the potential biological effects of UV irradiation.
